SASKATCHEWAN ARCHIVES QUESTIONNAIRES

PIONEER EXPERIENCES: A GENERAL QUESTIONNAIRE

NOTE: Please print all proper names and place names in capital letters. If you are not sure the name is correct as you have given it, please say so. It is quite acceptable to have someone else do the writing at your dictation.

1. Your full name: MISS (La VERNE LUBINKA JOVANOVIĆ)

2. Your address: PROV. NURSING HOME AND GERIATRIC CENTRE LEGIS. GROUNDS, REGINA, SASK.

3. Date: MARCH 28, 1962

4. Where were you born? (Give name of place and country): FARKAZDIN, BANAT, YUGOSLAVIA.

5. What was your father's name and occupation? MILITCH JOVANOVIĆ - BLACKSMITH IN EUROPE, FARMER IN CANADA.

6. When did you come to Saskatchewan? (Give month and year): NOVEMBER, 1903.

7. Mention any other places where you lived before coming to Saskatchewan, giving dates wherever possible: FARKAZDIN, BANAT, YUGOSLAVIA, EUROPE.

8. How old were you when you first came to Western Canada? (You do not need to answer this question if you would rather not or you may use "I was a small child," "I was in my teens," etc.): NINE MONTHS OLD.

9. What were your reasons for coming West? MY PARENTS DECIDED TO COME TO CANADA.

10. How did you learn about the West? (Through other people? Reading about it? Railroad or government information?) MY FATHER READ EUROPEAN NEWSPAPERS ADVERTISING CANADA'S NEED FOR IMMIGRANTS IN 1900-1902 ETC.
SASKATCHEWAN ARCHIVES QUESTIONNAIRES

PIONEER EXPERIENCES: A GENERAL QUESTIONNAIRE

NOTE: Please print all proper names and place names in capital letters. If you are not sure the name is correct as you have given it, please say so. It is quite acceptable to have someone else do the writing at your dictation.

1. Your full name: Miss (L.) Veane Jovanovich
2. Your address: Prov Nursing Home and Geriatric Centre
3. Date: March 28, 1962
4. Where were you born? (Give name of place and country): Farkaždin, Banat, Yugoslavia
5. What was your father's name and occupation? Militch Jovanovich - Blacksmith - In Europe
6. When did you come to Saskatchewan? (Give month and year): November 1903
7. Mention any other places where you lived before coming to Saskatchewan, giving dates wherever possible: Farmer Zdin, Banat, Yugoslavia, Europe
8. How old were you when you first came to Western Canada? (You do not need to answer this question if you would rather not or you may use "I was a small child," "I was in my teens," etc.)
9. Nine months - Old. My parents decided to come to Canada.
10. How did you learn about the West? (Through other people? Reading about it? Railroad or government information?) My father read European newspapers advertising Canada's need for immigrants in 1900-1902 etc.
11. What did your friends and relatives think of your decision to come to Western Canada?
   MY MOTHER'S PEOPLE AND FATHER'S RELATIVES WERE ALL AGAINST IT, BUT MY FATHER WANTED TO OWN HIS OWN LAND AND THE OPPORTUNITY OF GETTING LAND CHEAP.

12. Did you travel by yourself or with a party (family, friends or other group)?
   WITH MY PARENTS AND PARTY OF SIMILARLY MINDED FRIENDS.

13. What means of transportation did you use?
   RAILWAY ACROSS EUROPE, SMALL STEAM SHIP ACROSS ATLANTIC, PER GERMAN STEAMSHIP LINE, SAILIED FROM BREMEN, GERMANY.

14. What incidents of the journey West do you remember? (People you met on the way, meetings with Indians, adventures on the journey, accidents or other excitement, etc.)
   NONE, I WAS A BABY - IN 1903.

15. Where did you first stay when you arrived in Saskatchewan?
   REGINA, SASK.

16. Where did you settle or take up land?
   MY FATHER TOOK UP LAND SOUTH OF ROULEAU, SASK., SOME DISTANCE WEST OF MILE STONE, SASK.

17. Mention any other places where you have lived since coming to Saskatchewan.
   JUMILES SOUTH OF ROULEAU.

18. How did you earn a living before coming to Western Canada? How, after you came?
   (FATHER WORKED IN REGINA, SASK.) FARMED FROM SPRING TO FALL.
   IN THE CITY DID DELIVERY WORK FOR STORES - BAKERIES.
   HAULLED SAND AND GRAVEL FROM PILOT BUTTE AND BALCOMBE FOR THE BUILDING TRADES IN THE CITY. BROUGHT IN TRAIN CAR LOADS OF SAND AND GRAVEL FOR BUILDING CONTRACTORS.
11. What did your friends and relatives think of your decision to come to Western Canada?

My mother's people and father's relatives were all against it, but my father wanted to come.

12. Did you travel by yourself or with a party (family, friends, or other group)?

With my parents and party of similarly minded friends.

13. What means of transportation did you use?

Railway across Europe, small steamship across Atlantic, then German steamship line, sailed from Bremen, Germany.

None. I was a baby in 1902.

14. What incidents of the journey West do you remember? (People you met on the way, meetings with Indians, adventures on the journey, accidents or other excitement, etc.)

15. Where did you first stay when you arrived in Saskatchewan?

Regina, Sask.

16. Where did you settle or take up land? (Regina, Sask., distance of Royal Bay of Milestone)

My father took up land south of Royal Bay of Milestone.

17. Mention any other places where you have lived since coming to Saskatchewan.

In the city, did delivery work for Pilot Butte and Balmoral.

18. How did you earn a living before coming to Western Canada? How, after you came?

Father worked winter in Regina, Sask., farmed from spring to fall. In the city, did delivery work for Pilot Butte and Balmoral.
19. How often did you write to relatives or friends in your old home?
   MY PARENTS WROTE TO THEIR RELATIVES AS OFTEN AS THEY COULD.

20. If you got married, give the name of your husband or wife along with the date and place of marriage.
    NO

21. Did anyone else come to Saskatchewan because of your recommending it as a place to settle?
    NO

22. If other members of your family (brothers, sisters, parents, etc.) came West, tell when they came and where they settled.

23. Is there any particular experience of pioneer days that stands out in your memory which you would like to record?
    REMEMBER SEVERE COLD WINTERS, SAW BIG PRAIRIE FIRE OUT ON THE FARM, WHEN I WAS A CHILD, SAW MEN CUTTING BIG BLOCKS OF ICE DURING THE WINTER ON WASCANA CREEK, SAW PEOPLE FISHING ON WASCANA CREEK, SAW IN SUMMER WASCANA LAKE WITH WHITE SAIL BOATS ON IT, LIKE A BEAUTIFUL PICTURE. SAW THE INDIANS COME TO THE MARKETPLACE WITH THEIR LOADS OF FIREWOOD, SAW THE SQUAWS AND PAPOOS VISITING THE STORES ALONG 11TH AVENUE, SAW BUFFALO BILL WILD WEST CIRCUS ON THE MARKETPLACE.

24. Did you travel about much in the early years? (for business, attending church, visiting friends, etc.) How often? How far? By what means of travel?

IN 1910 ALL SCHOOL CHILDREN WENT TO THE EXHIBITION GROUNDS ON THE TRAIN TO SEE THE DUKE OF CAMBRIDGE AND DUCHESS OF ROYAL PARTY CELEBRATING THE CROWNING OF KING GEORGE V AND QUEEN MARY.

NO (Signature)
19. How often did you write to relatives or friends in your old home?  
   **MY PARENTS WROTE TO THEIR RELATIVES AS OFTEN AS THEY COULD.**

20. If you got married, give the name of your husband or wife along with the date and place of marriage.  
   **NO**

21. Did anyone else come to Saskatchewan because of your recommending it as a place to settle?  
   **NO**

22. If other members of your family (brothers, sisters, parents, etc.) came West, tell when they came and where they settled.

23. Is there any particular experience of pioneer days that stands out in your memory which you would like to record?  
   **REMEMBER SEVERE COLD WINTERS. SAW BIG PRAIRIE FIRE OUTON THE FARM WHEN ARMED CHILDREN SAW MEN CUTTING BIG BLOCKS OF ICE DURING THE WINTER ON WASCANA CREEK. SAW PEOPLE FISHING ON WASCANA LAKE WITH WHITE SAIL BOATS ON IT. LIKE A BEAUTIFUL PICTURE. SAW THE INDIANS COME TO THE MARKET PLACE WITH THEIR LOADS OF FIREWOOD. SAW THE MARKET PLACE WITH THE GOODS DOWN THE MARKET PLACE. SAW THE STAGECOACH STANDS THERE - LINN AND HAMILTON'S DAY VANS. SAW THE MARKET PLACE WITH THE OLD FOLKS. DID YOU TRAVEL ABOUT MUCH IN THE EARLY YEARS? FOR BUSINESS, OR VISITING FRIENDS, ETC. HOW OFTEN? HOW FAR? BY WHAT MEANS OF TRAVEL?**

In 1910 at school I went to see the Duke Royal and the Duchess Royal in England.

26. If you owned a car before 1914, when did you buy it? What make?

27. Where was your trading center? How far from your home?
   OUT ON THE FARM, ROULEAU, SASK.-16 MILES AWAY.

28. Did you continue to trade there? (Indicate any changes due to new towns appearing, better means of travel, etc.)

29. How often did you shop in the early days?
   ONCE A WEEK, OUT ON THE FARM, DURING SPRING, SUMMER, AND FALL.
   IN WINTER, WE LIVED IN REGINA.

30. When (if ever) did people in your district first start going to town regularly on Saturdays?

31. When (if ever) did you first begin to buy through the mail order catalogues? What kind of articles did you buy in this way? Indicate also what fraction of your total purchases were by mail order and any changes in the proportion of purchases made by mail order since the pioneer period.
   NEVER, ON THE FARM

32. When did you first have a telephone and what company provided it?

33. When you came to Saskatchewan the first time was it with the idea of staying permanently? Or did you make up your mind after trying it out? When did you make this decision?
   CAME OUT WITH IDEA OF MAKING OUR PERMANENT HOME.

Do you have in your possession or do you know the whereabouts of diaries, old letters, old posters and programs, minute books of community organizations, old pamphlets, old photographs, written recollections and reminiscences? (Describe.)

(1) be willing to lend them to the Provincial Archivist for copying?

(2) be willing to present them to the Archives Division of the Legislative Library, Regina, or the Archives Office at the University in Saskatoon? (Indicate your preference, if any)
